alert.note: Alert for South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 01 at 3:06AM MST until January 01 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...LONG DURATION WINTER STORM FOR MOUNTAINS...SNOW AND MIXED PRECIPITATION DEVELOPS OVER THE PLAINS THIS EVENING... .A storm system will move into the Desert Southwest today and then track to the Four Corners area late tonight. On Monday, it will move across Colorado and then push into the Central Plains by Monday night. This track will support development of widespread snow, as well as some light freezing precipitation across portions of the plains. In the mountains, ongoing heavy snow in the far northern tier of mountains will taper off late this morning. After a lull through the rest of he day, snow will redevelop this evening and continue through Monday and Monday evening before tapering off again late Monday night. Hazardous and slow travel conditions can be expected during this period. Across the foothills, I-25 Corridor, and adjacent plains, areas of snow will be developing this evening, with the most persistent snow spreading to the northern border area through early Monday morning. Behind that, areas of light freezing drizzle or rain will be possible, leading to icy road conditions. Precipitation will trend to almost all snow by mid to late afternoon Monday, and there may be an increase in snowfall rates as well especially on the northeastern plains into Monday evening. Travelers across the foothills and plains will encounter hazardous travel conditions starting this evening and continuing through Monday and Monday evening. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO MIDNIGHT MST MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations up to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 6 and 11 inches. * WHERE...Rocky Mountain National Park and the Medicine Bow Range. * WHEN...Snow will continue through mid morning, then a lull can be expected from late morning through the afternoon. More snow will redevelop this evening and continue through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.

area.areaDesc: South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet
